Hi Wesley, 

thank you. Yes, well this is the RTRL code, which is pretty mu=
ch like backprop but can train recurrent nets as well. But it is very slow =
as the number of neurons increases. I haven't done any optimizations on thi=
s part yet. If only feed-forward nets without loops and recurrence are evol=
ved, it should be easy to add regular backprop. Introducing a flag for cont=
rolling whether looped networks can appear in the population is on my todo =
list. (I don't mean looped recurrent connections, but any NN that has a loo=
p in the pathway between nodes like A->B, B->C, C->A)

Peter

ahoogroups.com, Wesley Tansey <tansey@...> wrote:

> curious. =
It would be great for my own research if you did indeed have this
> impleme=
nted.
